basedOn.display: MRI Whole Body MSK W/WO Contrast Prot

valueString:
Exam 1:  MBM 8786 - MRI WHOLE BDY MSK W/WO CONT PROT   -  Apr 28, 2016  
19:11    Acc#:15684852 
Exam 2:  MBM 5050 - MRI CHEST W/WO CONTRAST   -  Apr 28, 2016  19:11    
Acc#:15684853 
Exam 3:  MBM 6120 - MRI ABDOMEN W/WO CONTRAST   -  Apr 28, 2016  19:11    
Acc#:15684854 
Exam 4:  MBM 6210 - MRI PELVIS W/WO CONTRAST   -  Apr 28, 2016  19:11    
Acc#:15684855 
Exam 5:  MBM 8034 - MRI LWR EXTR LT NO JT W/WO CONT   -  Apr 28, 2016  
19:11    Acc#:15684856 
Exam 6:  MBM 8035 - MRI LWR EXTR RT NO JT W/WO CONT   -  Apr 28, 2016  
19:11    Acc#:15684857 






RESULT:   INDICATION:  Schwannomatosis. Scalp and left lung lesions 
status post resection.


TECHNIQUE:  Whole body MRI was performed on a 1.5-Tesla system using 
multiplanar 3-D anatomical and fluid sensitive sequences.  Contrast 
material was  administered.


COMPARISON:  Whole body MRI 2/23/2015


FINDINGS:


HEAD AND NECK:
No significant change left occipital subcutaneous lesion measuring 2.1 x 
4.5 x 2.5 cm (AP TV CC) with targetoid appearance and heterogeneous 
enhancement. ADC range 2 to 3.1.
No significant change left anterior neck lesion deep to the carotid 
bifurcation with target appearance heterogeneous enhancement measuring 
approximately 2.1 x 2.5 x 3 cm. ADC measurement limited by artifact.
No significant change 1.2 x 1.3 x 2.2 cm lesion left lateral to the 
larynx the target appearance and heterogeneous enhancement. ADC 
measurement limited by artifact.
Numerous additional smaller T2 hyperintense targetoid lesions throughout 
the head and neck appear grossly unchanged.


CHEST:
3 x 4 x 2.7 cm heterogeneous T2 hyperintense right apical mass with 
minimal enhancement. 1.3 x 2.1 x 1 cm T2 hyperintense left apical mass 
with minimal enhancement. Both not significantly changed. Limited ADC 
evaluation.
Similar multiple paraspinal masses largest on the left with targetoid 
appearance measures 1.7 x 1.8 x 1.6 cm minimal enhancement.
Tiny additional lesions too small to characterize.
Diffuse thickening of the bilateral brachial plexus.


ABDOMEN:
On the fluid sensitive sequences subcentimeter left subdiaphragmatic 
hyperintense focus (series 6 image 80)  unchanged compared to prior.
Visualized abdominal viscera grossly normal.
No suspicious lesions identified.


PELVIS:
Small bilateral hydroceles.
No suspicious lesions identified.


RIGHT LE:
Small knee effusion.
No suspicious lesions identified.


LEFT LE:
Small knee effusion.
No suspicious lesions identified.
